title: acer Swift 3 Core i5 8th Gen - (8 GB/1 TB HDD/128 GB SSD/Windows 10 Home/2 GB Graphics) SF315-51G Laptop  (15.6 inch, STeel Grey, 2.1 kg)

product_specification.Sales Package: Laptop, Battery, Power Adaptor, User Guide, Warranty Documents
product_specification.Clock Speed: 1.6 GHz with Turbo Boost Upto 3.4 GHz
product_specification.USB Port: 1 x USB 2.0, 2 x USB 3.0, 1 x USB Type C
product_specification.Screen Type: Full HD LED Backlit IPS Display
product_specification.Keyboard: FineTip Keyboard with Independent Standard Numeric Keypad
product_specification.Included Software: Acer Care Center, Acer Collection, Acer Portal, Acer Hover Access, Acer Configuration Manager, Quick Access
product_specification.Additional Features: 3220 mAh Li-ion Battery, Ultra Thin 18.9 mm All Form Factor, Acer Bio-Protection Fingerprint Solution, Control Keys: Volume Up and Down Keys

product_description.Design: This slender and stylish laptop features an 18.9 mm profile and weighs around 2.1 kg. Work all night long without straining your eyes as it comes with a backlit keyboard that illuminates this device's keyboard keys.
product_description.High-powered processing: Its powerful processors ensure - low power consumption, better CPU performance and enhanced graphics for a better multi-media experience.
product_description.Performance: Equipped with 8 GB of DDR4 RAM, this laptop ensures a glitch-free multitasking experience. The NVIDIA GeForce MX 150 graphics offers a truely immersive cinematic experience on its Full HD display.
product_description.Battery: Are you always on-the-go? Enjoy up to 10 hours of uninterrupted usage with its long-lasting battery.
product_description.Acer Fingerprint Reader: Ensure maximum security and experience convenient logging in with the Fingerprint Reader. It scans and verifies your fingerprint to auto login to your windows account.
product_description.Touch Display with IPS: Its display comes with the IPS technology that makes for a wide viewing angle that helps you share content easily. Watch videos or movies in consistent and brilliant colours.
product_description.Acer Color Intelligence: The leading panel software technology dynamically adjusts gamma and saturation in real time to optimize screen color, brightness and saturation. It minimizes clipping and over saturation for an enticing viewing experience.
product_description.Acer TrueHarmony: The Acer TrueHarmony speakers are made of an advanced foam material and deliver a powerful, acoustic experience.

review:
I was planning to purchase Apple MacBook but Flipkart offered me this best in class laptop on Valentine's Day sale @44k with no cost emi...

Awesome sound
2gb graphics
8GB ram best for GTA 5 players

Built quality, premium quality
Original windows 10
Thank you Flipkart for such a great deal

First of fall, I bought this laptop for 45K.
This is a OUTSTANDING LAPTOP for 45K.

.
=> BUILD QUALITY
Metal build, feels premium and quite heavy too though it weights just 2.1KG.
Track pad has really good response and large enough (supports gestures). Also having a Fingerprint, though its not good as your phone's one. Also have a backlit keyboard.
.
=> PERFORMANCE
Boots up in 10-13 secs , thanks to 128 ssd.
Opens Photoshop CC 2017 in 10 secs approx.
Playing GTA 5 on Normal settings, Some noticable lags are there though.
Also gets heats up very fast during gaming cause of metal body , Fans are below display but display won't get much heated although keyboard got heated on upper side.
.
=> DISPLAY
Got a Full HD 1080p Display with good viewing angles (Better than my friend's HP pavilion). Brightness is low for if you are using in direct sunlight. Screen is very reflective for outdoor use But looks good too in indoor condition, as it having a pure black screen.
.
=> BATTERY
Just okay okay. Normal use 5 Hrs approx.
Gaming 45 Mins( approx) .Plug power in while gaming.
.
=>FINAL VERDICT
Go for this if available near 50K, best deal. But I don't suggest this for 70K.
For further information or queries, contact me via Instagram- @govind.2

Hi Guys ,
Here i am writing whatever i feel after using this laptop for 1 week
firstly i got this laptop on big billion day by 45k . And as per my opinion its a best deal at this price .
here i'm not going to talk about the specification because it already a labelled on product.
but still i am making a birds eye view as this product keep updating every month .this i m saying because when i visited it last time there is difference in
display which updates to 15.6 inches from 14 inch and one more update is it's screen its previous version doesn't have anti-glare screen but current version have.

So quick review of Specifications:-
Core i5 8th Gen -
(8 GB(DDR4 2400 Mhz)
1 TB HDD/128 GB SSD(SATA)
/Windows 10 Home/

keyboard backlit

lets start with PROS:

10)camera is good enough but don't expect 4K

Cons:-
1)laptop heat while gaming but its fine not that much
2)although its only of 1.8 kg but still its feel like 3 kg of laptop due to metal finish.
3)heat vent is present on bottom so little heat if you are directly use it on mattresses due vent block air. but soon
cool as vent open .
4)Ethernet port is missing.

i haven't face any issue till 7 days of uses.And one thing that i wanna mention , please must buy acer 3 year extended warranty. while buys this laptop.or later you can register yourself within 7 days of purchase .

this laptop is best suited for CODDERS,official use ,and also for moderate gammer,

its a best deal for a student having budget less than 50K.on offer time .

thanks a lot to read it ,
Have a great time.

I've used the laptop for about 2 months now and I can say it's really good!

Pros
Insanely fast bootup time. Not even 10 seconds to start the laptop from a shutdown state. Windows updates are also are over in no time at all.
Metal build. That feeling you get when it has that cold metal touch when you take it out...
Pretty good graphics performance. Can play GTA 5 with moderately high settings pretty easily. Can't play it on Ultra graphics settings but if you want to do that, why are you looking at this laptop.
Lots of storage. 1 TB hard disk in addition to the SSD for storage and in emergency cases, when you can't install a big application on the SSD due to storage limitations, you can do it on the HDD.
Applications run smoothly. For a test, I used Premier Pro to render a 10 minute 4K video at max quality and it took just 13 minutes! Miles ahead of my old laptop.
Just the right weight for me. It sometimes feels surprisingly light.

Meh
Heat management. This is both a pro and a con. The laptop does heat up when playing heavy games or using resource-heavy applications but it stays mostly on the bottom part of the laptop and doesn't affect the keyboard area. But since the bottom can heat up a lot, it's advisable to get a stand or a cooling pad to raise the laptop bottom so the heat can dissipate properly. It stays cool most of the time otherwise when basic web surfing or anything like that.
Speakers are just ok. They can get loud but a bit more bass/low-end would make this the perfect laptop speakers for me. They could be a lot worse since it's just laptop speakers so can't complain much.

Cons
Battery life!! Acer claims it can last for 10 hours but it barely lasts just half that! I tried everything I can find to improve the battery life but max it can last is about 5 hours when just web surfing and normal use. Average is just around 4 hours. This is much lower than I expected when I brought it. But if you turn off the display or close the lid like when you leave it overnight for downloading something, it can last close to 10 hours. So that's nice, I guess.
Backlight bleed. I'm getting bleed from most of the screen edges and it really weakens the otherwise premium feel of the laptop. It doesn't affect normal use since you only notice it when you're staring at a black image like during startup or shutdown but it's there.
Wish the screen was more color-accurate. Now I have to manually calibrate it to get the right color but even then it isn't perfect. The Asus Zenbook has 100% SRGB gamut if you're looking for that and isn't much more expensive than this at the current price in Flipkart.

All in all, if you're looking for a powerful laptop that can handle heavy tasks, and which isn't too expensive (not the price right now. Wait for offers.) this is a very good choice for a laptop. It's not perfect but it gets the job done very well.

Yes it's a very nice product. Got this swift 3 at 45K on this Valentine's day. It has each and every feature like a smart phone. It is somewhat slippery, feels heavy weight, looks are superb, running smooth, no ethernet port as it is thin laptop, It has SSD that's the nice point. It doesn't have dvd drive. Backlit keyboard is nice. It is may not be the best at 70K but can be at 58-65K like Asus Vivo book. Full metal build and warranty comes under ITW so warranty works only in Bangalore and Delhi. Overall great product thank u flipkart and ACER.

I was fortunate to get this laptop at 45k (windows). I was looking for a laptop with SSD that could do average gaming with the latest generation i5.
Considering the price at which I bought this laptop, it would not be fair to say that the screen is not upto the mark. It is IPS LED but is glossy and reflective. Apart from the screen, the other thing is that it doesn't have the extra slot for RAM.
Apart from these two things there are only pros in the laptop. At 45k this was the best I could get anywhere in the world. Value for money!!

After lots of searching, I finally choose this laptop because of the paper specification.
Reason for buying the laptop - Latest System Configuration under 50K.

Likes
- Price - Its biggest advantage. No one is providing this specification at this attractive price.
- Build Quality.
- Storage - 128 GB M.2 SSD and 1TB 2.5" HDD
- Descent Performance
- Display. ( Satisfactorily Good)

About Storage Partition - There are two drive. First one is SSD (Windows installed here) and second one is HDD (Totally Free).

According my need what i dislike about this laptop
1. Battery backup - Not even the half as mentioned in specification. Getting around 4-4.5 Hrs even on normal usage.
2. Weight - Feels really heavy. Even its 2 Kg Laptop but its feels like 3.5 Kg.

The Perfect Laptop In This Price Range

Pros
1.Excellent Design Full Metal Body Gives It A Premium Look
2.Full HD IPS Display With Nano Bezel
3.Has Fingerprint Scanner
4.128 Gb SSD Good Performance
5.NVIDIA MX150 Graphics Big Games Can Be Played at Medium Graphics Settings
6.Upgradeable Ram And SSD

Cons
1.Battery Could Have Been an Little Better Not Bad On Average 4 To 5 HRs
2.Keyboard Is Good But Not Perfect Key travel Could have been Better
3.Sound Distortion At Higher Levels But Headphone Damping Is Good

Over All A Great Deal

I was looking for a mid range laptop for my office use to do some basic regular office stuffs.I had many options in 35-40K range with i5 processor and 4/8GB RAM. After going through few online research i just came across this Acer Swift 3 but the price was around 65K which wasn't the price segment i was looking for. But I just added it in wish list so that i may get it for a better price on Big Billion Day sale. When i check it later it was just 44,990 and it though it was 4-5K above my budget I booked it.

And Kudos to Flipkart and Team they just delivered it on time and when I opened it,it was just awesome,
Well packed, beautiful metallic built which gives very premium look,comes with inbuilt battery and when i power it on,it was just awesome, beautiful FHD IPS Display,nice keyboard layout and it didn't take even 15 seconds to boot up.

As it comes with 128GB SSD it's superfast,8GB RAM,intel i5 processor,1TB Hard Disk,15.6 Inch Full HD IPS screen with Gorilla glass protection and good battery backup.
I got everything what i was looking for.

You can go for it without any second thought.
GOOD DAY.

Had horrible experience with delivery. I got out for delivery notification for three days, rescheduled my work to be at home (had to exchange with my old laptop), and no one came for delivery. Their customer service is good for nothing. In fact, their whole delivery model is flawed. Their out for delivery notification is valid for whole day, and they don't commit on time slot, so in most of the cases I have to waste full day to get my order delivered. Now I hesitate buying from the Flipkart because of their delivery model.

coming to the product, it has sleek metallic body that looks attractive (though on heavier side). Laptop turns on and shuts down within 10 seconds, a big thumbs up to SSD. 1080p is nice, so is audio. Did not try extensive computing yet, but configuration is good enough for day to day computing need. Definitely a grate value for money!

Cons : Speakers are placed on lower side so get muffled voice if laptop is placed on flat surface. There is no Ethernet slot.

Another thing those who have doubt about ITW, I can clear you about the concept.
All the Acer laptops initially have 1 year onsite warranty and the ITW(International Travellers Warranty) is the extra benefit you are having. Suppose you are going abroad and you face issues or your laptop gets damaged, in this situation you can visit ITW centre of that country. Likewise, if any foreigner comes in our country and he/she faces some issues he/she can visit our country's ITW centre.

very very pathetic Acer India support. They don't respond if your laptop has any issues. keyboard stopped working after 2 months.

Previously I had given it a 3star rating but now I am going down to 0 Star my 2months experience. I was completely gone mad choosing Acer product for my business use. One of the main issue with acer is its Battery and Technical Support. These guys never respond you even via Call or Email. You just keep on mailing these guys but none of them will ever reply you back. And just within 2 months, my battery got dead and I complaint for it, and its been almost 14Days, But the battery is still not delivered from warehouse to Field technician,

I highly recommend you all to stay away from Acer if you guys are planning to invest a bigger amount in a business laptop. Simply Go with Dell, HP or Apple because their support is amazing. They figure out any system issue within 3 to 4 days max.

As a programmer, I would highly suggest that don't buy any laptop from ACER, this comes with tons of headache infact this is my genuine review after using it for more than 8 months and observing the same issues from other ACER users. Sometimes the battery charging will stop all of sudden, sometimes the keys won't work, sometimes the system will shut down unexpectedly and you will end up spending too much money on the hardware. I would suggest to go with a different brand if you are a avid user, because seriously you can't rely on this brand at all.
